To ensure Admin1 can assign Scaling1 to Pool1, they need permissions that allow managing Azure Virtual Desktop resources, which are already provided by the Desktop Virtualization Contributor role. If additional permissions are required, assigning the Owner role would be more appropriate.

Workload type Recommended file tier
Light (fewer than 200 users) Standard file shares
Light (more than 200 users) Premium file shares or standard with multiple file shares
Medium Premium file shares
Heavy Premium file shares

Selected Answer: C
FSLogix profile containers require Azure Files with SMB. While premium file shares (storage4) are recommended for performance, standard file shares (storage1) are also supported if they meet requirements. Storage2 (Page Blobs) and storage3 (Block Blobs) are blob-based and do not support SMB. Thus, only storage1 (standard file shares) and storage4 (premium file shares) are valid options.

Selected Answer: B
All FSLogix containers can be stored on file shares that support the SMB protocol.

Selected Answer: B
The solution assigns the User Access Administrator role to the Azure Virtual Desktop service principal, which manages permissions for others but does not grant Admin1 the specific rights needed to link a scaling plan to a host pool. Admin1 already has the Desktop Virtualization Contributor role, which inherently includes permissions to manage scaling plans. The proposed solution is unnecessary and unrelated to the goal.
